Posts.Content: Nov 4, 2008 04:53AM teresaob wrote: Sorry you had such a horrible time, but at least everything went ok on Monday!  I had a really bad time of it with my post it was painful and annoying at first and for some reason found having a mast. easier!  Everything ok now - due to get port out soon.  Best of luck with the rest of your tests, will be thinking you you.  It is a tough road ahead but you will find a way to reach the end, you will look back and be amazed at how far you have travelled!
Posts.Title: I broke down today Deb-from-Ohio Harley44

Posts.Content: Mar 13, 2010 11:19PM - edited Mar 13, 2010 11:20PM by teresaob What a pox( as we would say in Ire).  Makes me wonder if ther is a God.  We have just been told that our Daughters friend, age 7, was operated on for  a brain Tumor yesterday, that the next 72 hours our critical.  My kids were at her 7th birthday party last Saturday!!!!  How unfair is that.  I am starting to thinkcancer is one of those things that has no favorites or boundaries. Hugs to you and yours
Posts.Title: Does it get any worse than this? cmhartley Padiddle

Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2008 10:10AM teresaob wrote: Way to go Ginny!!!!! Glad everything went ok for you.
Posts.Title: Surgery tomorrow ginnysue teresaob

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2008 01:51PM teresaob wrote: Denise, I too was on those chemo drugs(and another one!) 6 sessions over four months.  I did everything the chemo nurses told me to, and as 'ilovemykids' says once the unknown is out of the way you start to really believe that chemo is doable. Its not plesant but you know you can do it. Believe it or not it was a relief for me when the hair started to fall out, though unlike some I got my DH to shave it off, what a laugh that was, god love him he tried to tell me I looked like Demi Moore in GI Jane.  Think he needs glasses!  The kids laughed!  I try to go through life like Pollyanna - seeing something good in everything.  Chemo was - saving a fortune by not getting hair done every six weeks, no waxing to be endured! Keep up the good thoughts  Lots of hugs
